result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leslie M Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Defendant Leslie M Smith in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant Leslie M Smith in custody.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

cab

Defendant Leslie M Smith in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant Leslie M Smith in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
The defendant was going to change her plea today on her newest case, 15cm2985, and go to sentencing on all cases.  The court had to stop the proceedings and ordered the case set for a trial.
Case is adjourned for another sentencing date in Branch 36 so that defense counsel can determine if a motion to withdraw her plea/s should be filed.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Leslie M Smith in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant Leslie M Smith in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defendant has been charged with a new case, which is set for a plea and sentencing date in Branch 36.
Court adjourned the sentencing scheduled today.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Leslie M Smith in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for final pre-trial however, the parties have reached a resolution. 
As to Counts 1, 2, and 3:   Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered these counts dismissed and read-in to case #15CM948 for the purposes of sentencing.

Court ordered the jury trial date of 08/19/2015 vacated.  Same conditions of bail apply. Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.

Defendant Leslie M Smith in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Court GRANTED state's motion of joinder of 15CM948 & 15CM1781. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am. Jury Trial scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 8:30 AM.

06/13/2015

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Darryll H.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Leslie M Smith in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant Leslie M Smith in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23 due to lower pending (15CM948).  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
